required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: eCEASE to Support Treatment for Parental Tobacco Use
clinical_study.official_title: Electronic Pediatric Office Systems to Support Treatment for Parental Tobacco Use

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed project aims to develop an innovative and disseminable electronic health record (iEHR)-based approach that supports optimal primary care workflows to routinely screen families for tobacco and e-cigarette use, address household smoking behavior and promote smoke-free and e-cigarette free home and car rules in a routine and effective manner in the pediatric setting. Additionally, parents enrolled in the study will be offered assistance by a community health navigator (CHN). This study aims to examine how effective the iEHR + Navigator strategy is compared to usual care control.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2-arm Randomized Control Trial with a stratified cluster randomization
study_design_info.masking_description: After the intervention has been assigned at random to one practice in each of the four pairs, the intervention will be blinded at random with either the label "A" or the label "B", and the other label will be assigned to the control practice. The statisticians will be blinded as to which of "A" and "B" is the intervention until the analyses are completed.

primary_outcome.measure: Parental combusted tobacco quit rate at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Parental 7-day combusted tobacco quit rates, as assessed by validated surveys, cotinine confirmed at 12 months between the iEHR + Navigator & usual care arms

secondary_outcome.description: Rates of parents' self-reported quit attempts between the iEHR + Navigator & usual care arms, assessed by validated surveys of parents

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of parental use of pharmacotherapy or services
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of parental use of pharmacotherapy and Quitlines between the iEHR + Navigator & usual care arms, assessed by validated surveys of parents

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of parental institution of smoking and vaping bans in their homes and cars
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of parental institution of smoking and vaping bans in their homes and cars between the iEHR + Navigator & usual care arms, assessed by validated surveys of parents

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental cost per quit of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Establish the incremental cost per quit of the iEHR + Navigator vs. usual care arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of tobacco use treatment delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the rates of tobacco treatment delivery (NRT prescription and quitline referrals) in the iEHR + Navigator arm vs. usual care, assessed by validated surveys of parents and EHR documentation

arm_group.description: Usual care delivery in pediatric primary care offices.

intervention.description: The iEHR + Navigator intervention consists of an iEHR part of the intervention in the pediatric primary care setting which will include routine screening of families for tobacco use and treatment delivery to parents who smoke and will be linked to the child's electronic health record. The enrolled parents will also be offered support from Community Health Navigators, who will work with offices to provide customized cessation support to tobacco users, ensuring access to medications and services.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parents or legal guardians who smoke, are present at the visit, and whose child is seen by a child healthcare clinician in a participating practice. "Smoker" will be defined as answering "yes" to either of the screening questions: "Have you smoked a cigarette, even a puff, in the past 7 days?" and "Have you smoked any other tobacco product (cigars like black and mild, hookah), even a puff, in the past 7 days?"
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Urgent/medical emergency visit;
2. Parent/legal guardian does not speak English;
3. No telephone; and
4. Prior enrollment in the study during a previous visit.

patient_data.ipd_description: At the conclusion of the study, after the associated research findings have been published, we will make our dataset available to investigators who email their data analysis plan to the principal investigators with the approval the IRB of record at CHOP and Health Information Services Group (responsible for ensuring HIPPA compliance). The data will be de-identified and validated. The dataset will include a codebook that defines the variables and describes the structure of the dataset.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: After the associated research findings have been published.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Email to the principal investigators at CHOP and MGH.
